text: we are going down underneath various
basements basements that are marble
shops upholstery shops an entire service
plant a power plant and we're going
under that
in the past if you'd stepped into this
elevator by mistake you face being shot
at the other end in case you told anyone
what you saw but we seem to be alright
so far after tunneling down through ten
storeys of solid rock the engineers
blasted and carved out a chamber almost
as large as the huge station concourse
above it's a mind-blowing twenty-two
thousand square feet and what was it
that was such a critical life-and-death
secret what was it that couldn't be
spoken about this it is a rotary
converter nine rotary converters each
weighing 15 tons transformed 11,000
volts of alternating current into the
direct current needed to power the
trains above they were the beating
hearts of the entire metro-north rail
network converting power to run trains
over 2,000 miles of rail track these
huge machines standing 20 feet tall were
put down here in 1913 because developers
wanted to build more profitable
skyscrapers on the land above 30 years
later their secret location turned out
to be a clever move when in 1941 America
joined the Allies and declared war
against Germany
the north eastern railway was crucial to
troop and weapons movements to the ports
and if the Transformers were sabotage it
could have crippled the war effort no
surprise then that this place was
guarded like Fort Knox armed troops were
stationed down here in this sub basement
with trigger fingers just waiting for an
authorized person to show up but a
German spy who had worked down here told
the Nazis about it and Adolf Hitler
recognizing its strategic importance was
determined to destroy it in order to
slow America's entry into the war Adolf
Hitler decided to send two submarines
with two saboteurs aboard each one to
the east coast of America
and the Nazis weapon of choice for the
secret operation was not explosives but
something much simpler back in 1942 this
sub-basement could have been easily
destroyed a made ineffective simply by
throwing sand into the rotary converters
it would have killed them and it would
have also effectively killed 80 percent
of the troop and war materiel movements
in the Northeast
fortunately the Nazi agents were spotted
coming ashore by a seaman second class
Coast Guard walking the beach the FBI
were contacted and they tracked the
would-be saboteurs about to make their
way down into that sub-basement they
were all arrested two of them were
executed an effort that nearly crippled
America's entry into the war was foiled
at the last moment
